javascript.name: JavaScript
javascript.description: A high-level, interpreted programming language that is widely used for web development, both on the client-side and server-side.

examples.title: Hello World
examples.explanation: This prints 'Hello, World!' to the console.

examples.title: Variable Declaration
examples.explanation: JavaScript has three ways to declare variables: const (constant), let (block-scoped), and var (function-scoped).

react.name: React
react.description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly web applications. It uses a component-based architecture and virtual DOM for efficient rendering.

examples.title: Simple Component
examples.explanation: A basic React functional component that renders a greeting.

examples.title: Component with Props
examples.explanation: A React component that accepts props and displays a personalized greeting.
